text:
Hey guys, it’s Ro! Welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

As some of you may know, today is National
Pizza Day!

And, in celebration of the new Deadpool movie,
I thought, let’s combine

these 2 things! Today, we are going to be
making a Deadpool Pepperoni Pizza!
Let’s get started!

The things you will need, will be: 2, 1-1/2
cup measurements of flour,

you’ll want to keep them separate because
we’re gonna add them at

different times. 1 Packet of Active Yeast,
1-1/2 Teaspoons of sugar,

2 tablespoons of olive oil, 1 teaspoon of
salt and 1 cup of warm water.

And then for toppings, we're gonna be using olives,
I’ve already got these
sliced, pepperoni, pizza sauce and some mozzarella!
Now let’s put it all together!

The first thing that we’re gonna do is we’re
gonna make our pizza dough.

I’m making mine from scratch, if you are
in a hurry, you can get the stuff

that’s already made. The recipe that I’m
using is the same recipe that I

made with my dad, Papa Pizza! On the cooking
channel special!

So, all you’re gonna do is take warm water,
sugar and yeast into a

medium sized mixing bowl. And you’re gonna
whisk it up until it’s nice and froth-three...
Fro-fy…
Frothy!
It will have little bubbles!

Once this is mixed up we are gonna add our first
helping of flour, so just pour
it in. Doo-doo-doo, doo-doo-doo!

Now I’m gonna be using a fork to mix it up because
the dough will be a little thicker.

You’re just gonna want to keep mixing this together
until it forms a loose dough,

and then we’re gonna be adding our oil and
salt.

OK you guys, side note! Do you remember when
I got this new hand mixer, in the

color watermelon? And it was like, backordered
forever, and then it came,

and I got so excited because it is my
favorite color ever that
Kitchenmaid has ever released?

I got the matching mixer stand! Boom! So this
is basically the best day ever!

The holidays were pretty good to me! I got
this puppy!

So we’re gonna make pizza with it! This
is the first recipe that I’m cooking

with this mixer and I’m so excited because
Pizza is 1 of my favorite foods

of all time! And I’m making 1 of my favorite
foods in my favorite color…
Ah-uhh, stand mixer!
“It’s true love!”
“It’s true love!”
OK!

The next step is we’re gonna add our dough
into our stand mixer, so you’re just gonna

open this up. And right here I have the dough
hook attachment, it just looks

like a little hook. It looks like Captain
Hook’s hook doesn’t it?!?!
Like if this was him…
Argh… Some good pizza…
What’s a joke?
What’s a pirate’s favorite pizza topping?
Arrrrrr-tichokes!
OK, I’ll stop! I'm gonna put this back on here.

And now we’re just gonna put our dough that
we’ve been working on, we’ll put him in here.

As you can see, it’s starting to look just
like pizza dough, but it’s

very sticky, it’s still too moist. So we
are gonna add our second helping

of flour, we are gonna add it slowly, as it
mixes.
You’re gonna want to mix on a medium speed.

On a KitchenAid that’s about, mmmm…  A
4 maybe... You don’t want to go faster than an 8!
Keep it between 4 and 6 everybody!
Don’t get crazy!

After you’ve added your flour, you’re
gonna run your mixer for about 3-4 minutes
just to knead the dough.

If your dough looks a little bit dry, and
it just isn’t balling, it isn’t forming

into 1 solid, you can add a little bit of
water, I’m adding 1 tablespoon at a time.
Add a little tablespoon and mix it up!

Once our dough is ready we’re gonna take
a big mixing bowl, I’m using a glass

bowl, and I’m just taking a little bit of
olive oil and I’m gonna grease my bowl.
Just put little drops in there, doo-doo, doo-doo!
Sorry!

And I’m just taking a little paper towel,
and I’m just gonna use it to
spread the oil all the way around.

Alright, we’re gonna take our dough,
put it right in the middle.

It can sit out at room temperature, you don’t
need to put it in the fridge.

And we’re gonna leave it out for a 1/2 hour
to rise.
Oooh! And look at that, our dough got fluffier!
One could say it rose to the occasion…
Of making pizzas…
OK I’m gonna stop now!

Now it’s time to roll out our dough, so
I’m just taking a little rolling pin,

rolling it! And of course you gotta spin it
in the air once, just like a real
pizza chef! Just give it 1 little spin!
OK, well, there we go!

I put my dough on a large, circular pizza
pan, but if you don’t have 1 you

can use a cookie sheet, that will work. But
I just like it because it

lets it breathe. Lets the crust breathe while
it’s baking.

Now I’m just gonna roll it out, I’m gonna
fill it to the edges of the pan because
I want a really big pizza!

Once you get your dough rolled out to about
the size you want, you can start

using your hands. And I’m just pressing
it into the corners.
Bewp-bewp-ba-bew!

Just finished rolling out the dough and now
it is time for my favorite part,
time to decorate!
We’re gonna be adding a little bit of sauce…
Oh jeez!
Yeah burpies!

You guys, I’ve been doing more burpies,
I can open jars better!

And, I’m gonna spread the pizza sauce all
the way around the pizza, but I’m

gonna leave a couple inches for the crust,
so leave some space.

We’re got our sauce on, and now we are gonna
add our mozzarella shredded cheese,

I’m just gonna open this up and again I’m
gonna be putting on a very thin layer

even though I love cheese, I don’t often
say this, that I’m putting on a thin

layer, but this time I am because I have a
lot of toppings going onto this pizza.

Oh! Don’t worry, I’ll make a quesadilla
with you later!

Now we’re gonna cover the entire pizza in
pepperoni, I’m just gonna start

outlining, right where our sauce starts, and
I’m gonna go in-in-in-in, boom!

We’ve got all of the pepperonis on our pizza,
and now we are gonna go back to some
mozzarella cheese. I forgot to mention this in the beginning, I said mozzarella cheese, but I forgot to

say you’ll also need sliced mozzarella,
just makes your life a little bit easier

for the eyeballs. So here I have got 2 slices
of mozzarella cheese, I am just gonna

put them down on top of each other, on this
little cutting board.

And then I’m gonna use a teardrop shaped
cookie cutter, or you can just use a knife
and eyeball it, thats fine.

Remove the excess cheese, and eat it all!
Yum-yum-yum-yum!
Mozzarella is my favorite!

And then using a sharp cutting knife, I’m
gonna cut it in 1/2, going right down
the middle of the tear.

Then you’re just gonna eyeball it and stick
it on top of the pepperoni!

The last topping that we’re gonna add are
the olives to make the
black part of his mask.

Now that our pizza is decorated, we are going
to heat our oven to 450 degrees,

and we are gonna bake our pizza between 10
and 15 minutes.

Just keep your eye on it, as soon as the crust
turns golden brown,
om-nom-nom! Take him out!

Ta-da! Here is the Deadpool Pepperoni Pizza
that we made today!

I even think it’s a pizza that Wade Wilson
would be proud of if you know what I mean!

It was super easy to make and, look at that!
It looks just like his mask!

I love making geeky themed pizzas because,
they’re relatively easy, you

can make any kind of themed design on the
top.

I’ll be posting pictures of this pizza on
Facebook, Tumblr, Instagram and Twitter,

and if you guys make this pizza, or any other
geeky themed pizza, please

send me a picture! I love seeing your baking
creations, I just get a big kick

out of it, it makes my day! Especially when
it’s pizza!

And, if you guys have any other ideas for
any other Nerdy Nummies, please let me

know, leave me a comment down below and I
will do my best to make it happen!
Alright, thanks again you guys, bye-bye!
Now it’s time to cut this pizza open!
